SENT.plain: Complete disappearance of a cerebral arteriovenous malformation (AVM), 9 years after its discovery, is reported in a 45-year-old man
This unusual evolution was revealed by the onset of 3 seizures
CT scan and MR imaging eliminated any hemorrhage and carotid angiography showed the spontaneous thrombosis of the whole malformation
The evolution of the MRI signals demonstrates that seizures and the disappearance of the AVM were concomitant
It is suggested that the spontaneous thrombosis of the venous drainage caused the AVM disappearance with cerebral oedema responsible of seizures
